content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Certainly! Here is an example implementation of the `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, f::FloatWithUnits)
    io.write($f.value)
    io.write(" ")
    io.write($f.unit)
    return
end
```
This implementation uses the `io.write` method to write the value and unit of the `FloatWithUnits` struct to the output stream in a single line, separated by a space.

Note: In Julia, the `io` object is an abstraction that represents the output stream. It can be used to write text to the console or to a file.
